name: Utkarsh Parasrampuria

current_company.name: Rawky Studios
current_company.title: Co-founder, Executive Director at Rawky Studios | IIT Kharagpur

positions.subtitle: Rawky Studios
positions.description: Our firm was incorporated in 2018 as a game development services provider.My responsibilities include:1. Taking our client projects to completion by gathering requirements, building an execution plan, designing solutions and delivering them.2. Design and execution of in-house casual and hypercasual games for Android and iOS platforms.3. Leading the team to collaborate and execute our game development projects.4. Researching various software solutions to include in our game development pipeline.5. Running BAU activities and managing accounting and compliance responsibilities.
positions.title: Executive Director
positions.description_html:
Our firm was incorporated in 2018 as a game development services provider.

My responsibilities include:
1. Taking our client projects to completion by gathering requirements, building an execution plan, designing solutions and delivering them.
2. Design and execution of in-house casual and hypercasual games for Android and iOS platforms.
3. Leading the team to collaborate and execute our game development projects.
4. Researching various software solutions to include in our game development pipeline.
5. Running BAU activities and managing accounting and compliance responsibilities.

positions.subtitle: Rawky Studios
positions.description: I worked part time to develop casino based games for Android and iOS, using Unity.My responsibilities included communicating with the client to gather requirements and build an execution plan.I worked on game programming, 3rd party services integration, QA and deployment.
positions.title: Freelance Game Developer
positions.description_html:
I worked part time to develop casino based games for Android and iOS, using Unity.
My responsibilities included communicating with the client to gather requirements and build an execution plan.
I worked on game programming, 3rd party services integration, QA and deployment.

experience.title: Software Engineer Intern
experience.description: I worked at Intuit's India Product Development Center as a Software engineer intern, to fulfill part of my credits requirement at the end of my 4th year of college. My responsibilities included:1. Migrating the "Statements" feature of the company's QBO product from legacy framework to target framework2. Understanding the concepts of the target framework (ReactJS) according to the way the company uses them, and integrating the feature into the product as a plugin.3. Ensuring that the plugin has no impact on the product by designing the test suite and implementing it.4. Writing automation tests using Selenium for different features of the product as an exercise in getting familiar with automation testing.I also participated in a 24 hour Hackathon that Intuit conducts as part of it's internship program.
experience.description_html: I worked at Intuit's India Product Development Center as a Software engineer intern, to fulfill part of my credits requirement at the end of my 4th year of college. My responsibilities included:1. Migrating the "Statements" feature of the company's QBO product from legacy framework to target framework2. Understanding the concepts of the target framework (ReactJS) according to the way the company uses them, and integrating the feature into the product as a plugin.3. Ensuring that the plugin has no impact on the product by designing the test suite and implementing it.4. Writing automation tests using Selenium for different features of the product as an exercise in getting familiar with automation testing.I also participated in a 24 hour Hackathon that Intuit conducts as part of it's internship program.

experience.title: Game Developer
experience.description: Developed, tested, deployed and handed over a bingo-cricket fusion game, named “GullyyT20”, for iOS and Android platforms, along with one teammate, within just over 2 months of time, beating by far the current industry standards.Developed, tested, deployed and handed over the backend and the web browser based admin panel built on Microsoft Server 2012 and Linux environments respectively, in the same time frame.

experience.title: Summer Intern
experience.description: Internship mainly focused on enabling offline payments (to retailers) through e-wallets. My main responsibilities were:-1) Realising the market reality in the payments sector through surveys and research, and utilising this information to develop a technology to enable offline payments.2) Developing an android widget for seamless and fast P2P cash transactions.

education.title: RBK School
education.description: I studied in RBK School, Mumbai from 5th grade to 10th grade, and passed out succesfully with 93.4% marks in 10th grade. RBK School is affiliated to the ICSE Board of Education. I opted for science as my elective subject and computer science as my 6th subject in 9th and 10th grade

volunteer_experience.info: As a cadet of 1(B) EME Coy NCC, I underwent training for numerous activities including drill, weapon training. I attended a Combined Annual Training Camp in Dec 2014 and was assigned the task of accounting and managing of supplies for the camp.I also participated in my unit's social activities such as blood donation camps, awareness rallies etc., and took responsibility for assisting in the administration of the unit.
volunteer_experience.subtitle: National Cadet Corps
volunteer_experience.title: Cadet

publications: [{"title":"An Optimized Distributed Recursive Matrix Multiplication for Arbitrary Sized Matrices","subtitle":"2020 IEEE International Conference on Big Data (Big Data)","date":"December 13, 2020","description":"This paper presents an implementation of distributed matrix multiplication algorithm for matrices of arbitrary order with minimal zero padding (using Apache Spark). The conducted experiments show that our implementation has strong scalability with increasing matrix size enabling us to multiply large matrices with upto 21% less wall clock time than MLLib, the in-built matrix multiplication implementation in Spark."},{"title":"On Distributed Solution for Simultaneous Linear Symmetric Systems","subtitle":"2020 IEEE International Conference on Big Data (Big Data)","date":"December 13, 2020","description":"In this paper, we present two distributed block-recursive approaches to solve large SPD (Symmetric and Positive Definite) systems - the symmetric version of the state-of-the-art Strassen's algorithm and Cholesky based inversion algorithm. We show experimentally that both the approaches have good scalability and Cholesky based approach is more efficient as it uses fewer matrix multiplications in each recursion level than Strassen based algorithm."}]
projects: [{"title":"A new image compression technique","start_date":"Feb 2015","end_date":"Feb 2017","description":"Worked on a new approach on compressing image using modified statistical approach of predicting color channels (RGB). Also worked on developing new modes of intra-prediction of pixel values, which is the core of how modern day codecs compress images."},{},{"title":"Loan default prediction","start_date":"Aug 2016","end_date":"Nov 2016","description":"Term project on loan default prediction: Predicting the loss to a financial institution if a borrower defaults, using linear regression model on data provided for previous cases of borrowers defaulting."},{},{}]

honors_and_awards.description: KDAG is a student driven consulting group. With competencies in R, SAS and Python, the group aims to provide end- to-end data solutions to its clients. It also aims at promoting a culture of data science in campus by organizing various seminars and workshops.
